record.title: ORDERS FOR FRIDAY, SEPTEMBER 21, 2007
record.narrative:
ORDERS FOR FRIDAY, SEPTEMBER 21, 2007 -- (Senate - September 20, 2007)

[Page: S11914]

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that when the Senate completes its business today, it stand adjourned until 9:15 a.m., Friday, September 21; that on Friday, following the prayer and pledge, the Journal of proceedings be approved to date, the morning hour be deemed expired, the time for the two leaders reserved for their use later in the day; that the Senate then resume consideration of H.R. 1585, the Department of Defense authorization, as provided for under a previous order.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
